Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2008 09:14AM GoldenEyes wrote: I am now on my 4th cycle.. I was taken off Xeloda for 2 weeks because of S/E..and I to feel it next day,, if I am on my feet too much, if I over due it day before.. MY feet have been very dry, cracked and I had bleeding at one point,, Use a LOT of lotion on hands and feet, I use Balmex and Udderly smooth, but I am having trouble finding them..I have 2 more cyles.. Hopefully.. that is it.. I do have question, not sure if I should post it here or on another thread..My Oncologist wants me to have the BRCA Genetic Test dont this week. I dont have Breast cancer in my family.. but MY parents both died from lung cancer.  I have had 3 recurrent breast cancer in last 5 yrs... this last time it spread to my lung..I am at high risk now for ovarian and if this test does come back positive.. Oncologist believe it will..HE is suggesting removal of my ovaries (I am 51) and possibly the other breast. Can someone give me some advice. or is there site where I can read more about this Test...how long will it take to get results. so sorry this is so long.. this just hit me in face other day... in shock at moment..Losing my one breast was enough.... Thank you

Posts.Title: Metastatic Disease notme whatnow

Posts.Content: GoldenEyes wrote: Hi Ladies, Once again, I wasnt sure where to post this..As some of you know. .I am stage IV..I have had ups and downs  like many of you.. I think of you ladies so often.. even though I am not here as often on the boards.. I keep you in my prayers all the time..I was wondering if any of you have had these symptoms at all..For almost a week.. I have had pain on the upper right side, near my rib cage under my right breast...I was able to tolerate it for while.. but in the last few days it was so un bearable.. I finally called the Dr.. I couldnt even sleep at night..It feels as though I was beaten up, I feel badly bruised.. sore.. just touching my skin hurt on that one side.. and it feels as though someone is punching me. I am in constant pain..Dr Did an Ultrasound he was so sure it was my gall bladder.. It showed nothing.. according to the US.. and Cat Scan of my belly area.. and blood work.. Everything looks alright..But I continue to have this pain.. I was on Medication for few days. .just so I could sleep.. But the side affects were awful.. I was so nausea...(Dilaudid?)  I went back to the Dr Today.. he said. .he has no idea why I am having so much pain.. Now he thinks it could be.. or was.. SHingles? I am now on a pain patch.. that really seems to be working.. I hardly feel any pain at th emoment...So here is my question.. Sorry this is long lol... Has anyone ever had this before? This type of pain? Its so confusing.. First they thought gall bladder. now shingles? So frustrating!.. I am going for my mammo next week..on the same side.. Maybe that will show something.. I also asked if this could be a bruise...wouldnt I be black and blue?....With the pain patch (:Lidocaine? sp? ) this is first time I have felt like myself in over week Thank you Ladies Dx 9/20/2007, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/1 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2008 01:51PM GoldenEyes wrote: Thank you so much for your replies. This is my 3rd time around with cancer. I have been on just about every type of chemo combo. Last one was Herceptin  but my cancer came back while I was still on it.. Then they put me on Tykerb/Xeloda...Its almost week and I still have the hand and food pain, swelling, finger tips especially. My Husband calls me Sausage Hands, LOL..At least I can still have sense of humor. WE ALL need to keep that..I will know what the next step will be when I see my Onc. next Thursday..I am hoping that he can lower the dosage on the Xeloda and I wont have to go to another drug I dread losing my hair again when finally it grew back. Taking the chemo at home (pills) has been great too. Thank you so much for your support, love.. Keep my thoughts and prayers for all of you Donna

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2011 05:44PM GoldenEyes wrote: Kasi, I am so sorry that you have to go through this. Chemo is a pain in the butt, but doable. Do you know which chemo you are getting?  Not all chemo drugs will make you lose your hair.  The last one I was on was Tykerb and Xeloda.. Nerve damage, but I kept my hair.. Even if you do lose your hair,, it grows back fast once you are done with treatment.. Think of it this way..You can be blonde one day, a brunette, you can be a fiery red head too  !  My husband had a different woman in bed with him every night !  Hahahhaha... Thinking of you, keeping you in my thoughts and prayers.. Great ladies here to support you and get you through all of this.. Donna

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2012 04:36PM GoldenEyes wrote: Ann, I am sorry you have to go through this again.  When I lost my hair the 2nd time around I had a crazy sense of humor.  I said, at least I dont have to worry about bad  "Hair Day"  Have fun with it. I had a blonde wig and an auburn wig..I would switch back and forth. My husband never knew which woman would be in bed with him,  Bald lady, the redhead or the blonde !  Hahaha..I used to order from the  TLC  Catalog.  I never bought expensive wigs  the most I paid was $50 and they looked better than the most expensive ones.  On hot days I would wear a cap on my head and velcro bangs to the cap and throw a scarf over it.  You can order just bangs through TLC.  I think of you ladies often even though I am not here as often.  This September 29th, it will be my 5 year mark..BC Mets to my lung..Keep fighting ladies,  dont EVER  give up...Kick this cancer in the butt !! Love Donna
